intro: Weinmannia velutina, commonly known as velvetleaf weinmannia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico, where it typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its soft, velvety leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are small and clustered in heads, usually appearing in the spring or early summer. Weinmannia velutina is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
